entry.title: It Wasn't Me
entry.summary:
Author: Gaaybriel

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,314Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 36

Summary: “And then I realised…it wasn’t me, was it?” Buck looks Tommy in the eye. Tommy takes a second to reply.“Look, Evan, it’s no one’s fault. It just didn’t work out. We don’t need to sweat it.”“No, that’s not what I mean.” Tommy tilts his head questioningly at Buck. Buck continues: “It was never me, was it?”-Buck confronts Tommy at work about a realisation and they have (what might be their first) truly honest conversation.08x11 Coda

entry.title: The Wild Boy
entry.summary:
Author: Warlock_Nerd

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,887Chapters: 21/28Kudos: 562

Summary: The 118 get a call to some nearby woodlands where the police are waiting for their assistance. Athena tells them that they need to help with a little boy that had gotten his leg stuck in a beartrap. All seems simple but then she tells them that the boy is a feral child, animalistic and frightened, and was throwing rocks at people who tried to get closer. Buck and Eddie are tasked to get him to safety.The boy is scared of everything around him, people, sounds, objects, the wind, the smells. Terror is all the boy knew until he found something he wasn’t scared of.And its name was Evan Buckley. :3Warnings - Heavy descriptions of medical trauma, child abuse, neglect and injury.Queue found family, Christopher being an amazing big brother and the 118 being the best family in the entire world. :3

entry.title: Champagne Problems
entry.summary:
Author: ash_ptv

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,682Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Following the events of Eddie leaving for Texas and Buck's one night stand with Tommy, Buck has to face the reality of not only living in LA without Eddie but living in what was Eddie's old house. Maddie has already encouraged Buck to learn to be alone and stay away from relationships knowing how her little brother can get when he is upset and not thinking clearly. Buck seems to be taking Eddie's advice to "not make everything about him" to heart and is avoiding sharing details of his personal life and struggle with his crew. Will this be a chance for Buck to get back together with his most recent ex? Or will Buck look more into the idea that his feelings for Eddie aren't as platonic as he may think as Tommy and Maddie have suggested.Eddie is finally back with Chris and he has a lot of time while job searching to focus on how he feels now that Buck isn't 20 minutes away anymore. Is Chris really satisfied in his life with Texas now that it is not just a place he could run from his dad? Why does Chris feel like part of his family is still in California, and not the family he was running from? How will Eddie feel now that Buck seems to be talking with Tommy again?

entry.title: This Heartbreak Quietly Rewired Me
entry.summary:
Author: talesofcamelot

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,631Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Eddie Diaz has just moved back to El Paso to be with his son, Christopher, hoping to rebuild their bond after their falling out. However, the transition is far from smooth. The challenges of adjusting to a new firehouse and trying to heal the emotional rift with Christopher proves to be more difficult than Eddie anticipated. While he navigates this new chapter, he leans on his family, but the weight of the situation is still heavy on his shoulders.Back in Los Angeles, Buck is grappling with a different, yet equally challenging, emotional battle. After a comment from Tommy—who accuses Buck of being in love with Eddie—Buck is thrown into a whirlwind of confusion. The comment strikes a chord with Buck, who starts questioning his own feelings toward Eddie. He’s torn between what feels right and what he’s been telling himself is impossible.

entry.title: Like You Were My Closest Friend
entry.summary:
Author: isthatacatsherlock

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,002Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 177

Summary: Helena did not know that Buck took care of him after he got shot. She certainly didn’t know that he stayed with Chris until he came home from the hospital. She didn’t know what a natural move it was for Buck to take over his lease because he already fit so nicely into his life. She wouldn’t always say anything, but when she did they were just little comments she could tell had some deeper resentment under them.“Sounds like he helped with Chris a lot,” she said one morning over coffee.“It wasn’t like a big deal or anything,” said Chris. Helena was looking at Eddie when she responded “mhm.”It would be impossible to get her to understand, but he needed him here. In theory the choice to move had been easy. Not a choice at all – Chris, above all else. That was true. Buck didn’t just matter, though. He was entwined.

entry.title: The Bolter
entry.summary:
Author: Jack3402

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,139Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 46

Summary: From a very young age, Evan Buckley knew he would end up alone.After Eddie leaves to go after Chris, Buck knows that he needs to get out of Los Angeles for a while. He travels just like he did before he joined the 118, looking for a reason to keep going after losing the family he thought would finally stay.Eddie moves to Texas and slowly but surely gains the trust of his son back. After 4 long months of long conversations and hard realizations, Christopher finally wants to move back to Los Angeles.But what happens when they return and Buck is nowhere to be found, and nobody but Maddie is able to get in contact with him? What happens when Eddie finds out just how badly he hurt the love of his life, and now he can't tell him just how much he truly needs him to be okay?
